page.title: 05WELL DRESSINGS (2)
page.content: Sometimes we use some hard maize. For the sky we use blue petals. For the trees we use green holly leaves. We use lots of different kinds of leaves from trees. We soak the base-boards in the River Bradford for several weeks and we soak the clay too. When we take them out of the river we spread the soft clay on the base-board. A Bible picture is pricked out on the clay from a pattern drawn by someone in the village. We stick the flowers into the clay. On the nearest Saturday to St. John the Baptist's Day (June 24th.), at five o'clock in the morning, we put the well dressings up. They are about 2 metres tall and 1 metre wide. Lots of people come to the village to see the well dressings, so it is a very exciting week in the village. Nicola Shimwell (7)
